newsitem.title: USA: New York City policeman dies in shooting.
newsitem.headline: New York City policeman dies in shooting.

text.p: A police officer was shot dead late Sunday night in a crime-ridden New York neighbourhood, the fourth policeman to die in the line of duty in the city this year, police said Monday.

Housing Bureau Officer Brian Jones, 27, was shot in the head amid gunfire in a crowd in the East New York section of Brooklyn, apparently after trying to help a fellow officer settle a dispute. He was declared dead an hour later in the hospital.
Police arrested a suspect and recovered the weapon that authorities believed was used in the shooting, a New York City police spokeswoman said.
Police identified the arrested man as Antoine Windley, a parolee with a record of drug arrests.
